subject: Politics
title: The Suez and Panama Canals
description: A fast breakdown of The Suez and Panama Canals for builders.

hook.text: In 2021, a stuck ship in the Suez Canal cost the global economy $400 million per hour. Chokepoints matter.

buildup.text: The Suez and Panama canals are artificial shortcuts that save weeks of shipping time. They're economic lifelines.

discovery.text: The Suez Canal handles 12% of global trade. The Panama Canal connects the Atlantic and Pacific oceans.

twist.text: Both canals have been tools of power. Britain seized Suez in 1956. The US built and controlled Panama for decades.

climax.text: Climate change threatens Panama's canal â€” it needs fresh water to operate. Drought already limits ship traffic.

punchline.text: Two narrow canals carry the global economy. Block one and the world feels it.

quiz.question: What happened when a ship blocked the Suez Canal in 2021?
options: It cost the global economy about $400 million per hour
